elements.title: Paul Parkman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Paul Parkman (pictured), one of the developers of the rubella vaccine, did not monetize the patent so that the vaccine could be freely available?

elements.title: command information newspaper (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that according to a former military journalist, 80,000 copies of a command information newspaper were dumped into the South China Sea during the Vietnam War?

elements.title: Zhang Zhenglang (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that despite specializing in literature and serving as a senior editor of the Zhonghua Book Company, historian Zhang Zhenglang never published a single book of his own?

elements.title: Way Less Sad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that AJR's "Way Less Sad" samples the final trumpet riff of Simon & Garfunkel's "My Little Town" as its primary hook?

elements.title: MT Petar Hektorović (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when MT Petar Hektorović was temporarily reassigned, one resident of Vis wrote an online memorial to the ship, writing "the waves of Vis grieve for you"?

elements.title: Drew Thomas (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Drew Thomas, a former car salesman, reached the finals of the NBC show Last Comic Standing?

elements.title: Bad Dürrenberg shaman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Bad Dürrenberg shaman may have been able to block blood vessels to her brain by holding her head at certain angles?

elements.title: 1964 New York World's Fair pavilions (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a New York man built a house with materials from several 1964 New York World's Fair pavilions?

elements.title: meat diapers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that putting pre-moistened meat diapers in pre-packaged meat is a form of weight fraud?
